class Block

Detailed Description

This class is a DataPin. A Block uses one or more DataPin to send/receive data messages from other Blocks. A data message transports buffer identifiers that allow a block to get data chunks on the connecting wire.

Build a DataPin. The accepted parameters must be set using some tuning criteria.

Parameters:
b block that owns this pin.
name descriptive name of this data pin.
dir pin direction, one of DIR_INPUT or DIR_OUTPUT.

bufcount preferred count of managed buffers.

Send the specified buffer to all connected peers.

Parameters:
buf the buffer to send.
pri the priority of this buffer (0 = highest).
md avt_metadata to fill correctly by source or filter.

Returns:

int32 uStreamLib::DataPin::tryRecvMessage (  dmessage *  m  ) 
 

Receive a message from the peer. This method checks if there is a message in the queue. It is non blocking.

Parameters:
message structore to store the message into.
Returns:
SUCCESS or FAILURE if no message can be received now.

Definition at line 208 of file data_pin.cpp.

int32 uStreamLib::DataPin::trySendMessage (  dmessage *  m,
int32  priority = 0
) 
 

Send a message to the peer. This method returns FAILURE if the message cannot be delivered. It is non blocking.

Parameters:
message a pointer to the message.
Returns:
SUCCESS or FAILURE if the message cannot be delivered now. SUCCESS means that at least one message was sent.
